egyptian_landmarks.name: Pyramids of Giza
egyptian_landmarks.description: The iconic pyramids, including the Great Pyramid of Khufu, are ancient monuments located on the Giza Plateau.

egyptian_landmarks.name: Karnak Temple
egyptian_landmarks.description: A vast complex of temples, chapels, and pylons dedicated to the Theban triad, located in Luxor.

egyptian_landmarks.name: Egyptian Museum
egyptian_landmarks.description: Home to an extensive collection of ancient Egyptian antiquities, including the treasures of Tutankhamun.

egyptian_landmarks.name: Valley of the Kings
egyptian_landmarks.description: A royal burial ground for pharaohs, featuring tombs adorned with intricate hieroglyphs.
egyptian_landmarks.address: West Bank of the Nile, Luxor, Egypt

egyptian_landmarks.name: Abu Simbel Temples
egyptian_landmarks.description: Massive rock temples built by Ramses II, known for their impressive facades and intricate interiors.

egyptian_landmarks.name: Philae Temple
egyptian_landmarks.description: An island temple complex dedicated to the goddess Isis, renowned for its beautiful architecture.

egyptian_landmarks.name: Siwa Oasis
egyptian_landmarks.description: A remote oasis known for its natural beauty, salt lakes, and the ancient Temple of the Oracle.

natural_places.name: Wadi El Rayan
natural_places.description: A protected area known for its beautiful waterfalls, lakes, and diverse wildlife.

natural_places.name: Mount Sinai
natural_places.description: A historic mountain in the Sinai Peninsula, significant for its religious importance and hiking trails.

natural_places.name: Colored Canyon
natural_places.description: A narrow canyon with walls featuring colorful layers of rock, offering a unique hiking experience.

natural_places.name: Nile River
natural_places.description: The longest river in the world, flowing through Egypt and providing lush landscapes along its banks.

natural_places.name: The White Desert
natural_places.description: A desert area known for its white chalk rock formations, creating a surreal landscape.

natural_places.name: The Black Desert
natural_places.description: A desert region characterized by volcanic hills and black stones, offering unique scenery.

natural_places.name: Lake Nasser
natural_places.description: A vast reservoir in southern Egypt, known for fishing, boating, and its surrounding natural beauty.

egyptian_cities.name: Cairo
egyptian_cities.description: The capital city of Egypt, known for its rich history and landmarks such as the Pyramids of Giza and the Egyptian Museum.

egyptian_cities.name: Alexandria
egyptian_cities.description: A Mediterranean port city founded by Alexander the Great, famous for its Greco-Roman landmarks and the modern Bibliotheca Alexandrina.

egyptian_cities.name: Giza
egyptian_cities.description: Home to the iconic Giza Plateau, featuring the Great Pyramids and the Sphinx.

egyptian_cities.name: Luxor
egyptian_cities.description: Often referred to as the world's greatest open-air museum, Luxor is known for the Valley of the Kings and Karnak Temple.

egyptian_cities.name: Aswan
egyptian_cities.description: A city on the Nile River, known for its beautiful scenery, the Aswan High Dam, and Philae Temple.

egyptian_cities.name: Sharm El Sheikh
egyptian_cities.description: A resort town between the desert of the Sinai Peninsula and the Red Sea, known for its beaches and coral reefs.

egyptian_cities.name: Hurghada
egyptian_cities.description: A beach resort town stretching some 40km along Egyptâ€™s Red Sea coast, known for scuba diving.

egyptian_hills.name: Tell el-Fara'in (Buto)
egyptian_hills.description: An archaeological site in Kafr El Sheikh Governorate, believed to have been a religious and commercial center in ancient times.

egyptian_hills.name: Tell Kom El-Hegena
egyptian_hills.description: An archaeological site in Dakahlia Governorate, believed to have been an urban center in ancient times.

egyptian_hills.name: Tell Kabrit
egyptian_hills.description: An archaeological site in Dakahlia Governorate, containing remains of ancient settlements.

egyptian_hills.name: Tell El-Khanzir
egyptian_hills.description: An archaeological site in Dakahlia Governorate, believed to have been a religious and commercial center in ancient times.

egyptian_hills.name: Tell Sidi Salem
egyptian_hills.description: An archaeological site in Kafr El Sheikh Governorate, containing remains of ancient settlements.

egyptian_hills.name: Tell El-Galala
egyptian_hills.description: An archaeological site in Dakahlia Governorate, believed to have been an urban center in ancient times.

egyptian_hills.name: Tell Senghar
egyptian_hills.description: An archaeological site in Dakahlia Governorate, containing remains of ancient settlements.

tour_packages.name: Trip to the Pyramids
tour_packages.description: Enjoy a tour to the Giza Pyramids, one of the Seven Wonders of the World.

tour_packages.name: Karnak Temple Tour
tour_packages.description: Discover the rich history of Karnak Temple in Luxor.

tour_packages.name: Nile River Cruise
tour_packages.description: Enjoy a special cruise on the Nile River.

tour_packages.name: Visit to Abu Simbel Temple
tour_packages.description: Discover the magnificent Abu Simbel Temple in Aswan.

tour_packages.name: Luxor City Tour
tour_packages.description: Enjoy a tour in the historic city of Luxor.

tour_packages.name: Visit to Hatshepsut Temple
tour_packages.description: Discover the magnificent Hatshepsut Temple in Luxor.

tour_packages.name: Valley of the Kings Tour
tour_packages.description: Enjoy a tour in the famous Valley of the Kings in Luxor.
